page.title: 02Industry - changing times
page.content: Until the Industrial Revolution, Denny and Dunipace were separate villages in a very rural area and there was no major road through them. People worked the land. Towards the end of the 18th century there were several woollen and linen {mills}on the River Carron. The linen mills closed causing unemployment but the supply of pure water brought a new industry, calico printing. This also failed after a time but from it grew the paper_making trade.The importance of this industry increased for a century but today there is only one paper_mill left. Large amounts of{mineral wealth brought{employment}to the area.There was iron_ore,coal and fire_clay. All brought prosperity.Today there is great unemployment but Denny people never lack courage and hope.
